questions.question: When caring for a client with preeclampsia, which action is a priority?
options: Monitoring the client’s labor carefully and preparing for a fast delivery
Continually assessing the fetal tracing for signs of fetal distress
Checking vital signs every 15 minutes to watch for increasing blood pressure

questions.question: The safest position for a woman who is in labour with cord prolapse:
The pathological retraction ring of Bandle is associated with:
Six hours after delivery, the nurse notes that a woman’s fundus is two finger breadths above the umbilicus and deviated to the right of the midline. What is the most likely cause of this finding?
In threatened abortion, the size of uterus

A 32 year old gravida 3 para 0 at 13 weeks gestation presents to the emergency room with profuse vaginal bleeding after coitus. She also has mild abdominal cramps. Examination shows soft abdomen and the cervical os to be more than 2 cm in diameter and the presence of clots and tissues in the vaginal vault. U/S shows products of conception still present in the uterus. The most probable diagnosis in this case is:
Conservative treatment of placenta previa indicated in all of them except:
options: Delayed termination of pregnancy till (37-38th w)
Indicated in presentations after the 37th week
If baby is alive, small amount of bleeding

questions.question: A 35-year-old gravida 3, para 2 woman who is 38 weeks pregnant presents to the ED with painless, bright red vaginal bleeding. Which of the following is contraindicated?
A pregnant women suffering from heart disease gets breathless and excessive fatigue on doing ordinary activity but is comfortable at rest. Her cardiac function status is class
Which of the following contraceptive method is contraindicated in a woman with heart disease?
Which of the following indication of IUCD:
On which of the postpartum days can the client expect lochia serosa
All of the following are causes of bleeding in early pregnancy except
Which of the following is the dominator of face presentation?
HELLP of preeclampsia complication means:
options: Hemolysis, elevated liver enzymes, low WBCs
Hemolysis, elevated liver enzymes, low RBCs
Hypertension, elevated liver enzymes, low platelets
Hemolysis, elevated liver enzymes, low platelets

questions.question: How would the nurse check for clonus in a woman with preeclampsia?
options: Assess for beating of the foot when quickly dorsiflexed
Assess dorsiflexion by quickly plantar flexing

questions.question: Which of the following is the main cause of placenta abruption?
The best time for Folic acid supplementation during pregnancy is:
After doing Leopold’s maneuvers, the nurse determines that the fetus is in the ROP position. To best auscultate the fetal heart tones, the Doppler is placed:
options: Above the umbilicus at the midline
Above the umbilicus on the left side
Below the umbilicus on the right side
Below the umbilicus near the left groin

questions.question: Which of the following means anterior vaginal prolapse?
In which degree of uterine prolapse, the cervix protrudes from the vulva on straining?
Which of the following is a precaution must be considered before using chemical contraception method?
options: It is used down in the vagina
No douche used for at least 6 hours after coitus
Used only one time and never repeated

questions.question: The contraceptive method which serves as a protection from sexual transmitted diseases (STD’s):
The following complications during pregnancy increase the risk of postpartum hemorrhage (PPH) except:
A nurse in the postpartum unit is caring for a woman who has just delivered following placenta previa. Which complication can be associated?
Which signs differentiate threatened abortion from inevitable abortion?
Which of the following is the most likely affect the fetus if the woman is severely anemic during pregnancy?
Which of the following measures would the nurse include to prevent breast engorgement?
options: Feeding the neonate max 5 minutes per side
Wearing a supportive brassiere with nipple shields
Breast-feeding the neonate at frequent intervals

questions.question: Which of the following conditions is most likely to be associated with disseminated intravascular coagulation?
Mona 39 years old, 7 weeks pregnant, severe vaginal bleeding (prune juice), headache, moderate pain. Doctor says fetus never developed and pregnancy abnormal. Nursing diagnosis?
When administering magnesium sulfate to a woman with preeclampsia, the nurse understands that this drug is given to:
The uterus is small for gestational date in case of:
What is the most significant symptom of ectopic pregnancy?
Which of the following is a symptom of placenta previa?
All of the following maternal factors are associated with abruption placenta EXCEPT?
Which of the following refers to major neonatal complication after birth of a diabetic mother?
The results of a pregnant woman’s glucose challenge test were 158 mg/dL. What is the next test?
When assessing a woman with a history of PIH, which finding should the nurse explore at each visit?
Pregnancy is diabetogenic due to which of the following?
Which of the following most common types of breech presentation?
What is the following fetal complication of placenta previa?
Vaginal bleeding in molar pregnancy is prune juice.
Pre-eclampsia can cause disseminated intravascular coagulopathy (DIC).
Oxytocin is administered for cardiac women to shorten the second stage of labor.
Oral glucose tolerance test (GTT) is the standard test for diagnosis of diabetes mellitus.
When the fetus is rapidly expelled and the duration of labor is less than 3 hours, it is called preterm labor.
The cervix protrudes from the vagina in a patient with first degree uterine prolapse.
Estrogen hormone is responsible in the proliferative phase.
The most important nursing assessment during the fourth stage of labor is distention of the bladder.
Normal labor is expulsion of fetus and placenta.
Proteinuria develops earlier in women with preexisting hypertension than in women with pre-eclampsia.
Prolonged labor can be defined as prolongation of the process of labor beyond normal limits.
Diabetes mellitus associated with pregnancy is a significant factor contributing to prenatal morbidity.
Decidua vera lies directly over the blastocyst and separates it from the uterine cavity.
Mentum is the denominator in brow presentation.
The sacrum is the denominator in breech presentation.
The anterior fontanel is triangular in shape.
Pre-eclampsia commonly necessitates the use of antihypertensive agents in the puerperium.
If the front wall of the vagina is prolapsing below the bladder, it is called cystocele.
Neonatal hypobilirubinemia is a fetal complication of diabetes mellitus.
Pain is the first sign in ectopic pregnancy.
Ovulation always occurs in the early menstrual cycle and around menopause.
The ovary is under the influence of FSH in the secretory phase.
The glomerular filtration rate increases in pregnancy.
